title: Projects and Case Studies
text: This page highlights selected projects and assignments from my MBA program and work experiences. Each project includes the problem, my approach, and what I learned.

title: Projects and Case Studies
text:
1. Social Media & Brand Awareness Campaign
Role: Marketing Officer
Problem
The company needed improvement in social media engagement and consistent messaging.
What I Did
- Created and scheduled digital contents
- Coordinated marketing and communication with the team.
- Suggested small improvements such as better task sequencing and clearer responsibilities and ensured visual consistency.
What I Learned
I learned the ways to plan and schedule digital content effectively, which eventually help me understand the role of consistency to improve the social media engagement. Working closely with the marketing team enhance my communication and coordination skills. It made me realized how small process improvements such as organizing tasks more clearly and defining responsibilities will make the team work more efficiently. Moreover, I gained a better understanding of visual consistency and its impacts on unified brand messaging.

title: Projects and Case Studies
text:
2. Customer Experience & Store Presentation Improvement
Role: Sales Associate
Problem
The store‚Äôs presentation and product arrangement needed improvement to create a better shopping experience for customers.
What I Did
- Organized shelves and maintained visual layout.
- Assisted the customers and answered product questions in a friendly ways.
- Helped to manage inventory and daily stocks.
What I Learned
I learned to the importance of maintaining an visually appealing store layout and its impact on customer experience. With this experience my communication and customer-service skills were improved. I also gained practical experience in handling inventory and daily stock management, helping me understand how proper product availability and organization support smooth store operations.

title: Projects and Case Studies
text:
3. Applying Marketing Segmentation
Course: Marketing Management
Type: Short written assignment
Context
I analyzed a consumer product using basic segmentation concepts.
What I Did
- Described the product and its benefits
- Defined a target market using demographic and psychographic factors.
- Suggested a possible positioning statement and simple digital channels to reach this audience.
What I Learned
I learned how segmentation and positioning help marketers focus their message on a specific group instead of trying to appeal to everyone at once. Download Report (PDF)
Click here to view the full PDF

title: Home
text:
About Me



I am an MBA candidate at University Canada West with interests in
operations, digital transformation, and data-driven decision making.
I have hands-on experience in media and marketing with more than
two years of experience as a marketing officer. The job included
simple market research, designing promotional content, and
maintaining social media platforms. I also worked as a sales
associate where I gained teamwork, communication skills, and the
ability to work under pressure.  
<br><br>
This portfolio highlights selected coursework, projects, and skills 
that demonstrate my analytical thinking, collaboration, and 
communication.
